intro: Pteronia flexicaulis, commonly known as the woolly pteronia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It produces clusters of pale yellow or white blooms during the summer months. Pteronia flexicaulis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
